page.title: 14Marsh Playing Fields, Kinver
page.content: There are approximately 10 acres of field surrounded by woodland. There is a football pitch. There is a small park which has a climbing frame, spinning top, three swings a slide and a see-saw. Next to the park is a bowling green. There is quite a large car park. There are two large buildings used for discos or other entertainment. One is the Kinver Community Association Hall and the other is the British Legion. There is also the Senior Citizens Club. Along the edge run the River Stour and the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal where you can fish.
